### About the Data

This weekâ€™s [#TidyTuesday](https://tidytuesday.netlify.app/) dataset dives into the monstrous depths of the [2024 System Reference Document for *Dungeons & Dragons*](https://tidytues.day/2024/2024-12-17), offering a bestiary full of creature stats and storytelling potential. Curated by [Jon Harmon](https://github.com/jonthegeek) from the [Data Science Learning Community](https://dslearning.substack.com/), the [`monsters.csv`](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-05-27/monsters.csv) file contains detailed attributes of dozens of D&D monsters, including their size, type, challenge rating, ability scores, alignments, languages, and special abilities. Whether you're interested in identifying which types of monsters boast the highest Strength or the widest range of challenge ratings, or you're analyzing language distribution for monster communication, this dataset presents a wide canvas for exploration.

### Loading required libraries

```{r}
#| label: setup

pacman::p_load(
  tidyverse,            # All things tidy
  
  scales,               # Nice Scales for ggplot2
  fontawesome,          # Icons display in ggplot2
  ggtext,               # Markdown text support for ggplot2
  showtext,             # Display fonts in ggplot2
  colorspace,           # Lighten and Darken colours
  
  magick,               # Download images and edit them
  ggimage,              # Display images in ggplot2
  patchwork             # Composing Plots
)

monsters <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2025/2025-05-27/monsters.csv')
```

### Visualization Parameters

```{r}

# Font for titles

seecolor::print_color(bg_col)

social_caption_2 <- glue::glue("<span style='font-family:\"Font Awesome 6 Brands\";'>{xtwitter};</span> <span style='color: {text_hil}'>{xtwitter_username}</span>")
```

### The Plot

```{r}
#| label: base-plot



  labs(
    title = plot_title,
    subtitle = plot_subtitle,
    caption = plot_caption
  ) +
  theme_void(
    base_family = "body_font",
    base_size = bts,
    base_line_size = bts / 100,
    base_rect_size = bts / 100
  ) +
  theme(
    # Overall
    legend.position = "none",
    text = element_text(
      margin = margin(0,0,0,0, "mm"),
      colour = text_col,
      lineheight = 0.3
    ),
    
    # Labels and Strip Text
    plot.title = element_textbox(
      colour = text_hil,
      margin = margin(10,0,-40,0, "mm"),
      size = bts * 2.5,
      lineheight = 0.3,
      hjust = 0.5,
      halign = 0.5,
      vjust = 0.5,
      valign = 0.5,
      family = "title_font",
      face = "bold",
      fill = alpha("white", 0.7),
      box.color = NA,
      padding = unit(0.7, "lines"),
      r = unit(5, "mm")
    ),
    plot.subtitle = element_textbox(
      colour = text_hil,
      margin = margin(55,0,-75,0, "mm"),
      size = bts * 1.2,
      lineheight = 0.3,
      hjust = 0.5,
      halign = 0.5,
      vjust = 0.5,
      valign = 0.5,
      family = "caption_font",
      fill = alpha("white", 0.7),
      box.color = NA,
      padding = unit(0.5, "lines"),
      r = unit(5, "mm")
    ),
    plot.caption = element_textbox(
      margin = margin(-20,0,10,0, "mm"),
      hjust = 0.5,
      halign = 0.5,
      colour = text_hil,
      size = 0.7 * bts,
      family = "caption_font",
      fill = alpha("white", 0.6),
      box.color = NA,
      padding = unit(0.3, "lines"),
      r = unit(5, "mm")
    ),
    plot.caption.position = "plot",
    plot.title.position = "plot",
    plot.margin = margin(5,5,5,5, "mm")
  )

ggsave(
  filename = here::here(
    "data_vizs",
    "tidy_dd_monsters.png"
  ),
  plot = g,
  width = 400,
  height = 500,
  units = "mm",
  bg = bg_col
)
```
